column4: My cpu governor does not scale quickly enough the frequency . for ex. rendering web pages requires high cpu just for one second.
how can I made my cpu governor scale  my frequency faster ?
You could disable the scaling ..
Not sure if you actually can make it faster
but than the cpu will always run on its max
to render a web page with flash its just one second. that's not enough to trigger the governor
Wait a sec.. I'll try to find some info on this
h4l: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/107545
h4l: maybe that could be some help .. look at the devices/system/cpu/cpu0/cpufreq/ondemand/sampling_rate line
h4l, lowering it should make it sample more often
I found this one http://allredb.wordpress.com/2009/05/07/speed-up-flash-and-firefox-in-ubuntu-jaunty-904/
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/107545
maybe that could be some help .. look at the devices/system/cpu/cpu0/cpufreq/ondemand/sampling_rate line
lowering it should make it sample more often
ok . will try that
you can just echo to it with 'echo <number> | sudo tee <thefile>
now sure if you should do it with all cores though
carresmd:iceroot: http://linux.digitalsp.com/2009/08/improving-stuttering-during-flash-video.html this is even better
that's probably a better solutions .. But it won't increase the sampling time though
well I changed up_treshold to 40. now it looks my FF renders pages quiqer
glad to see it worked.. And if you undo the changes you just made and edit the sampling_rate file .. Does that have any affect as well?
